title: ECR Day (for PhD students and those who identify as Early Career Researchers)
description:
Ahead of the main programme we will be running an optional event for Early Career Researchers (ECR). This will be open to all PhD students and those who identify as ECRs who are attending the symposium. It will provide an opportunity for relaxed engagement and networking.

Please indicate that you wish to attend this session when you register. All are welcome, but we have a limited space in the room so sign up is necessary.
Introduction: Zhengxin Yu, Helena Webb, Mohammad Soorati, Joe Deville
Roundtable 1: Engaging with RRI as an ECR Scholar
The main symposium activities start tomorrow

description: Register and collect your badges for TAS '23. Refreshments on arrival.

title: Session 7: Plenary: Prof. Gina Neff
description: Gina Neff is the Executive Director of the Minderoo Centre for Technology & Democracy at the University of Cambridge. Her books include Venture Labor (MIT Press 2012), Self-Tracking (MIT Press 2016) and Human-Centered Data Science (MIT Press 2022). Read more...

title: Session 10: Responsibility in TAS
description: Panel discussion exploring what it means to be responsible in Autonomous Systems, and the place of responsible research and innovation in the TAS programme. The panel includes Samuel Baker, Shoaib Ehsan, Elvira Perez Vallejos, Alex Beach, and Shannon Vallor.

title: Concluding comments
description: Proceedings end with concluding comments from Kate Devlin, Joel Fischer and Gopal Ramchurn.
